title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 557.1 - Background and intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 557.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) COVID-19 is an
unpredictable disease that can cause serious illnesses and death. In response
to this increased public health threat, New York must take active steps to
prevent and control transmission of COVID-19. The seriousness of the continuing
threat and the failure to achieve acceptable vaccination rates through
voluntary programs necessitate further action. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14
ยง
557.1

Adopted

New

York State Register September 28, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 39, eff. 9/8/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
